question: Who has been appointed as the new president of the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII)?
explanation: Brijendra Pal Singh, who is the director-producer of the popular crime investigation series C.I.D.,  has been appointed as the new president of the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) Society and Chairman of Governing Council. He succeeded  Anupam Kher, who had stepped down as the chairman in October 2018 citing \"international commitments\". As per provisions of FTII rules,   Singhâ€™s  tenure will be for the remaining period of block of three years starting from March 4 2017. Prior to being nominated as the new FTII chief, Singh was serving in the capacity of vice chairman of the FTII Governing Council.
